text.tspan: Tapping Fiber-Optic Data on the Cheap

flowRoot.flowPara: Abstract: Network security is a very important concept in today’s information society. With heavy reliance on data communications comes also a responsibility for its security. While fiber cables are an improvement over traditional copper with respect to tapping, it is still very possible to tap these cables. We will give a proof of concept for tapping fiber communications “on the cheap”, using less than 30 Euro in hardware materials.
As such we recommend that confidential data communication needs to be encrypted, even when using fiber optic cables.
Remove the outer shielding using a utility knife.
Carefully make a small opening in the inner fiber using sandpaper.
Bend the cable and check if some of the light comes out.
Tape the phototransistor to the cable and measure its value using a simple pull-up circuit.
Record the measurements and analyze them.
